title: Biedma Department
text:
Biedma is a <a href="Departments%20of%20Argentina">department</a> located in the north east of <a href="Chubut%20Province">Chubut Province</a>, on the Atlantic coast of <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>. The spelling Viedma is also sometimes used, but the spelling "Biedma" is preferred, to distinguish the department from the city of <a href="Viedma">Viedma</a> in <a href="R%C3%ADo%20Negro%20Province">Río Negro Province</a>.
The provincial subdivision has a population of about 59,000 inhabitants in an area of 12,940 km², and its capital city is <a href="Puerto%20Madryn">Puerto Madryn</a>, which is located around 1,334 km from <a href="Buenos%20Aires">Buenos Aires</a>.
Economy.
The main contributors to the economy of Biedma are tourism, fishing, farming and the production of <a href="Aluminium">Aluminium</a>.
Sport.
Puerto Madryn is home to two <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> clubs; <a href="Club%20Social%20y%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Guillermo%20Brown">Club Social y Atlético Guillermo Brown</a>, who play in <a href="Torneo%20Argentino%20A">Torneo Argentino A</a> and <a href="Deportivo%20Madryn">Deportivo Madryn</a> that currently play in <a href="Torneo%20Argentino%20B">Torneo Argentino B</a>.
